DOC.brief_summary: Background : Antibiotic treatment cholangitis often remain insufficient due inappropriate antibiotic use bacterial resistance . Objective : To evaluate role routine bile collection endoscopic retrograde cholangiography ( ERC ) percutaneous transhepatic cholangiography ( PTC ) microbiological analysis antibiotic management cholangitis identify risk factor microbial growth . Design : Prospective , observational , diagnostic study . Setting : Hannover Medical School , Hannover , Germany . Patients Interventions : Consecutive patient undergo ERC/PTC biliary complication orthotopic liver transplantation , malignancy , primary sclerosing cholangitis , benign stricture choledocholithiasis . Main outcome measurement : Microbiological examination bile sample
DOC.brief_title: Routine Bile Collection Microbiological Analysis During Cholangiography
